Stalker need the services of a guide who knows a particular locality. We need to get him where you want.

back to Cook

a Shared notebook group, use it for entertainment purposes. the Prototype of this "product" was common in the Stalker environment, "dawn". Its main advantages can undoubtedly be attributed to the reduced weight as body armor, and supplied clothing (rubber in many places just cut) and an additional installed container for the artifact. Unfortunately for combat operations this sample mediocre thoughts is not able, but it will help in the hunt for artifacts in the initial path of becoming a Stalker.

Excursion to hell
Sidorovich suggested to follow the inexperienced until they get experience.

Work, eh? Well, there's one thing. You do not like green snot already, as far as I can tell from your profile in the CCP, grrh. Ugh. In short, crammed to me some boobies, please show that, and how it's here in the Area. Well, I'm their Fan and they sent this damn double-crossing, said, they say KBM among the newcomers is no longer performed, but I know unnecessary death is not needed, the reputation she, like the nervous cells are not restored. So I asked the village to wait until a suitable candidate is not found. Well, the occasion of these jerks around? It is necessary that they not with empty pockets left you with joyful expressions on their faces.
Keep from those pricks you a little gift:
Oh, Hey man! You et we are here to show the romance going? Come on, we are at your Beck and call and relax, we're flexible.
was there something You wanted? We all do right?
Listen, thank you, man. We will never forget you, and if the Contractor will come, and your life sugar make. Goodbye, friend!
yeah.
to learn the fate of his comrades
member considers it has been asked to inquire about the fate of their comrades, who was last seen in the Cemetery near the chemical machinery of the anomalous zone.

Work? I think it is unlikely you can help me. Wait, drink this. I and my comrades went on reconnaissance on the cemetery equipment, you know this fucking place is a vast wasteland with skeletons of different techniques. Here we reported that somewhere saw sobolowski squad, but those pricks we never found... but found something else. Frightening something that made my Sol... friends fall to my knees to grab the head. I don't know why this happened to me, same as why I ran away. It's a shame. Look, I certainly do not believe that the boys are still alive, they are already a couple of days of no news, but can you at least confirm their deaths? The coordinates of the place I will send you on a PDA, is near some of the anomalous zone with chemical fumes. Help?
So they're dead? Damn, you are... tokens. Sorry, here's my backup barrel and optics to it. Thank you.
to collect bark from mutilated trees
Herman asked me to help him research the local flora and to go to the Red forest for specimens of the bark.

welcome. Work we always have our MBU dealt and research of flora, including, for example, some time ago we asked the Stalker to deliver us some plant to study its properties. Now we are interested in the anomalous grove in the "Red forest", which is located in the middle of the anomalous zone "Symbiotic". We will need samples of bark from the mutilated trees you can find. Do you agree?
Oh, great! Let them here. Take from me a useful artifact:
to escort the stalkers

you Need to take dongara in the area of the landfill, they carry out some orders scientists. People have little, so someone has to cover the back come from?

to Destroy the civilian zombies
From Amber to the junkyard came a zombie and came to one of the garbage heaps, you need to neutralize them.
is There a good job for the hunter. You're a hunter, right? Hold the crab In General, you need to clean up one of the garbage heaps from the zombies, the coordinates throw off your PDA. Ready?
From., take honestly earned:
to Kill the burer-pyromaniac
a Night to relax at the hot around one of the anomalous zones out burer. The more they come should not.

My weapon became very ill, get me something better, well, for example "Protect". And then to think that these creatures everywhere his hands pulled, groped... need something more capacious and rapid-fire.

to Destroy the base of the bandits
Need to dislodge the bandits from their primary locations on the moor.

This work needs to perform before morning, as in the camp at this time, the least these bastards. I've gathered the guys who can get even with the bandits on their main base in the fishing village, you go with them? Only the guys don't crash if veressa one, I'll never forgive.
Thanks, that's from me to you. You deserve to wear that uniform.
You are our guide? I note the desired location on your PDA. You need to ensure our safety on the way to it and once we're done, to hold us back. The award will receive on return to the camp.
was there something You wanted? We need to hurry, it's dangerous to stay long.
Thank you Stalker. You did a good job, here is your reward.
Good.
Et you here means scholar of the surrounding area? Hmm, well, lead.
Wanted something? If not, then don't bother.
Thank you, man - get us a good barrel.
Good.
unremarkable chimney
Miklukha

Often used by stalkers as a fallback in case of unforeseen circumstances. Its main feature are weak, but nevertheless a simple strap which can be reset along with the backpack at any moment and quickly run away. Quite compact and roomy. \n%c[255,238,153,26]in the application allows you to reset your backpack along with some content.
You need a knife

Raise the bridge ($$ACTION_USE$$)

For a more detailed overview of the battle, press tilde to open the console enter: "demo_record 1" (without the quotes). The chamber is controlled: "w","s","a","d" and in combination with clamped ctrl. The exit is via esc.

notebooks
Notebook with SOPEMI belonging to probably the most the Arrow. It is painted in detail how to get into the underground complex, referred to as a laboratory "x-18".
PDA
Personal PDA in maps, which present interesting information. Need to flip it.
Personal PDA, in the "map" which present interesting information. In the tab "message history" has a password set.
A route between two areas has become accessible.

A flight data recorder, or a "black box". Flight recorders are used to record the status of internal systems and crew conversations, and can provide vital information in the event of an accident. In the Zone, stalker and military personnel alike are interested in these devices.
Flight recorder
Opening hours of the local merchant: from 6 am to 8 pm.

of a Doctor we are not here, and to survive as it is necessary. Sometimes medicines are not enough, as our knowledge in this matter, and we have everyone on the account. I heard that the stalkers are in demand artifact, the "Soul" who can heal the wounds. Will bring it for us?
Thank you, soldiers will thank you.
Find artifact "Film"
a Fan asked me to find for a novice artifact "Film"

so here's the deal. A beginner we have one in the village to eat, went to the dump in the swamp is acidic, and I found there is a artifact. To celebrate, I ran immediately to the village to brag, but my bad luck, the military braked. Well, whatever the hell the patrol was. Here, art and some equipment they had was taken away, and the man is grieving now sits - the first art and immediately lumpy. Well, who could know that would happen? Art is very rare, "Film" is called. I would go there himself, but I can't leave young animals alone, they are there so uchudil... not gonna help brother-Stalker?
Thank you, I think that guy will be happy. And that to me is sniveling don't need... and so hard to live.
to Clean up the deli
Need to clean up the nearest grocery store from their pesky mercenaries dogs.

Hello, we have again the problem. Rather it is a long-standing problem. Dogs love to hang out near the grocery store, could you have them all there to shoot? Too close they settled down from our camp, and even its bark to attract attention to us. I understand that it is long, but please take care.
well Done, thank you. Keep a little money:

There is one thing. Every day the Cordon is becoming more dangerous. Have here den all the more dangerous mutants, and we are in any case impossible to prevent their reproduction! You'll have to clean up the area that I marked on your PDA. Kill every creature that they see. If you do not in debt will remain. So what?
Thank you, thanks to you, newcomers will be in relative safety. Here's your reward.

Find [%s]
the Technician in the "Jubilee" of the BWC asked for him to bring [%s] to conduct more complex operations on the modernization of weapons in the glory of the Monolith!
Listen, bro. Help me to get the tools to help our brothers on the battlefield, so they could more effectively carry His word to the masses of unbelievers.
Listen, bro. Help me to get the tools to help our brothers on the battlefield, so they could more effectively carry His word to the masses of unbelievers.
Great, brother. All the money from the improvements go to the charity, your contribution was deserves a small discount.

the Technician in the "Jubilee" of the BWC asked for him to bring [%s] to conduct more complex operations on the modernization of weapons in the glory of the Monolith!
the Previous set was not enough, I need the tools for fine work. Will serve our cause again?
the Previous set was not enough, I need the tools for fine work. Will serve our cause again?

the Technician in the "Jubilee" of the BWC asked for him to bring [%s] to conduct more complex operations on the modernization of weapons in the glory of the Monolith!
These tools was enough, but why stop there when you can make it even better? I think is calibration tools, can you get them?
These tools was enough, but why stop there when you can make it even better? I think is calibration tools, can you get them?

the Technique at the depot required [%s] for more complex modernization of weapons and armor.
the Base was a here recently, but has already raised the issue of lack of tools for our brothers. For starters, I could use some tools for rough work. Get?
the Base was a here recently, but has already raised the issue of lack of tools for our brothers. For starters, I could use some tools for rough work. Get?
Great, this will help us to gain a foothold and become even stronger. I think you deserve a discount.
Find [%s]
the Technique at the depot required [%s] for more complex modernization of weapons and armor.
As shown, our weapons inferior to the weapons of the infidels only by a few points. They also have a lot of good techies. I need tools for fine work to free our brothers from these needs. Taken?
As shown, our weapons inferior to the weapons of the infidels only by a few points. They also have a lot of good techies. I need tools for fine work to free our brothers from these needs. Taken?
Good work, now gear our brothers will be one of the best in this "region". For helping you again have a discount.
Find [%s]
the Technique at the depot required [%s] for more complex modernization of weapons and armor.
We will be able to surpass them all, brother! And for that I will need tools for calibration. Bring them to me?
We will be able to surpass them all, brother! And for that I will need tools for calibration. Bring them to me?

Well, that's all. Soon we will take the all the surrounding area, with such collateral. I have no money, they all go to the needs of the brotherhood, but have you at any time treat, I told you in the first place will help.
Find %s
The technician in the Truck Cemetery has asked me to find %s.
Bro, more than half of the stuff we got here is breaking apart, and I really need some tools to help out the lads. Wanna help?
Bro, more than half of the stuff we got here is breaking apart, and I really need some tools to help out the lads. Wanna help?
Oooh, yeah... That's what I'm talkin' about. Tell ya what - since you helped me out, Imma help you out with a discount.
Find %s
The technician in the Truck Cemetery has asked me to find %s.

This area is complete wilderness, but this place right here... It's a strategic point, man! To get our comrades as much firepower as possible, we're gonna need some better tools to work with. Help me out again, will ya?

This area is a complete wilderness, but this place right here... It's a strategic point, man! To get our comrades as much firepower as possible, we're gonna need some better tools to work with. Help me out again, will ya?
Oh, fuck. You're the best, man. You'll definitely be getting another discount for that!
Find %s
The technician in the Truck Cemetery has asked me to find %s.
Was just sittin' around, chillin' like villains, when I realized what we were missing. That's right, even better tools! Anyways, 'sup with you? Wanna help find some?
Was just sittin' around, chillin' like villains, when I realized what we were missing. That's right, even better tools! Anyways, 'sup with you? Wanna help find some?
Wow, you actually fuckin' did it! Thanks, pal, you're the best. Biggest discount goes to you, enjoy it!
Find %s
Seryoga, a military technician, has asked me to find %s.
I do, actually. We recently left all our tools at the research complex in Yantar, which is why I can't even repair the BTR here. I need tools - basic ones. Mind helping out?
I do, actually. We recently left all our tools at the research complex in Yantar, which is why I can't even repair the BTR here. I need tools - basic ones. Mind helping out?
Thank you so much! I will give you a discount.
Find %s
Seryoga, a military technician, has asked me to find %s.
Sadly, the tools that you gave me aren't enough, as they only work for the most basic of upgrades. I need more advanced tools - they shouldn't be too rare to find. Could you find them for me?
Sadly, the tools that you gave me aren't enough, as they only work for the most basic of upgrades. I need more advanced tools - they shouldn't be too rare to find. Could you find them for me?
Much appreciated. A big "thank you" from everybody here.
Find %s
Seryoga, a military technician, has asked me to find %s.
I'm tired of rummaging around for BTR parts... It's time to get our guys equipped with some proper gear. I could use a different kind of tools - calibration tools. Can you provide me with those?
I'm tired of rummaging around for BTR parts... It's time to get our guys equipped with some proper gear. I could use a different kind of tools - calibration tools. Can you provide me with those?
Amazing. Never thought I'd see such sophisticated technology again... especially around here. And you won't stop me from giving you a fine discount.
Find %s
The tech gangster has asked me to bring him %s.
Stalkers snatched everything and set up defenses at Yanov, those fuckers. We ain't got shit! Need some tools, man. Get me some, yeah?
Stalkers snatched everything and set up defenses at Yanov, those fuckers. We ain't got shit! Need some tools, man. Get me some, yeah?
Ah, beautiful! Someone's getting a discount.

The tech gangster has asked me to bring him %s.
Listen, I don't wanna bother you too much and all, but could you just bring one more kit here? Need a better kit to improve our shit, you know? It's hard for us here without the right upgrades, heh.
Listen, I don't wanna bother you too much and all, but could you just bring one more kit here? Need a better kit to improve our shit, you know? It's hard for us here without the right upgrades, heh.
Thanks, man. You're a real guy, you know that?

Hey, buddy, the two other sets of tools you brought us is really helpin', but I need the best o' the best. You know... the shit that'll make 'em go, "oooh, yeeeah..."
Hey, buddy, the two other sets of tools you brought us is really helpin', but I need the best o' the best. You know... the shit that'll make 'em go, "oooh, yeeeah..."
Well, fuck me sideways! What a rarity... a real rarity. I'll give you another discount, you deserve it. Thanks, bro.
Find %s
A mercenary technician has asked me to bring him %s.

Listen, what kind of mercenaries are we without well-maintained and custom equipment? You know, we used to have tools for anything, but some fuck stole them from the substation workshop. So, I need tools, and not shitty ones either. Can you find us some?

Listen, what kind of mercenaries are we without well-maintained and custom equipment? You know, we used to have tools for anything, but some fuck stole them from the substation workshop. So, I need tools, and not shitty ones either. Can you find us some?
Damn, you deserve a discount. Thanks.
Find %s
A mercenary technician has asked me to bring him %s.
Having reliable weapons is nice, but so far we're without any sufficient upgrades. Will you find me an even better set of tools?
Having reliable weapons is nice, but so far we're without any sufficient upgrades. Will you find me an even better set of tools?
Thank you. Let's see how much I can help you and the others out with this!

A mercenary technician has asked me to bring him %s.
Listen - let's finish our job, shall we? I need calibration tools to make sure that no scumbag escapes us.
Listen - let's finish our job, shall we? I need calibration tools to make sure that no scumbag escapes us.
Oh, fuck... You are the hero of every technician! Well done indeed... I'll be doubling your discount.

A mercenary technician in the Outskirts has asked me to find %s.
Well, we've sorted out a few issues, but there's still a lot left to do. Need better tools for even more upgrades. Mind helping out again?
Well, we've sorted out a few issues, but there's still a lot left to do. Need better tools for even more upgrades. Mind helping out again?
Well done. Now I have a full set, and you can have all the discounts you're entitled to.
Find %s
The technician at the sawmill has asked me to fetch him %s.

As you already understand, the wilderness here is utterly unreal. Although this is a former sawmill, nothing is left but the logs. I could use some kits to work with... If you can find basic ones, please bring them here.

As you already understand, the wilderness here is utterly unreal. Although this is a former sawmill, nothing is left but the logs. I could use some kits to work with... If you can find basic ones, please bring them here.
Thanks... Things are going to be much easier. Keep this artifact - it's called a Pellicle. Quite rare.
Find %s
The technician at the sawmill has asked me to fetch him %s.
Since you've already found one set of tools, do you happen to know where some more advanced ones are? I desperately need them.
Since you've already found one set of tools, do you happen to know where some more advanced ones are? I desperately need them.
Thank you, thank you. Here's a small discount.
Find %s
The technician at the sawmill has asked me to fetch him %s.
I understand that it might be too much to ask in this godforsaken place, but maybe you could help me in finding a third, more complex kit? An expert's kit will do just fine.
I understand that it might be too much to ask in this godforsaken place, but maybe you could help me in finding a third, more complex kit? An expert's kit will do just fine.
Thank you for everything. Perhaps this wretched place will turn into a fully fledged camp someday.
Any free info can you share about the surrounding area?
Usually info is how I make a living, but since everything's quiet anyway, I can give you a bit of an insight.
I'm all ears.

Well, you're in Rostok. It's completely safe for anyone on good terms with Duty. To the west lies the Wild Territory, former western part of the Rostok factory. Rumors advise against going there at night. The best kill zones are held by the mercs, so you'll likely be getting shot from two sides. There are mutants in the lower lands, and it's better to stay at a height provided by warehouses... Although, the mercs have them covered. That's all about the Wild Territory. To the north lie the Army Warehouses, held by Duty's "best friend", Freedom. There's nothing particularly interesting going on there, but it's the last shelter around for sane people. To the east is the Truck Cemetery - stock up on anti-radiation supplies and ammo if you're going there. There are a lot of mutants and sometimes the radiation is way past what even we consider to be normal. To the south is the Garbage - complete anarchy going on over there... You've got mutants and thugs, but you've also got a neat marketplace. Plus, there's some kind of hunter in the train hangar who might have some jobs to offer. That's all for the roundabouts, need anything else?
You mentioned something about a shelter for sane people?
Well, north of the warehouses is the Radar, an eerie place held by the Monolith. It's best to stay away from there - no way of getting in with the psy-installation they've got set up.
Thanks for the info.
Tell me about yourself.

I used to be stationed at the Agroprom Research Institute before I got a promotion. Before the Zone came into existence, I was a car mechanic. Duty noticed my skills as a handyman after I had been around for a while, so they decided to assign me as technician here. I prefer tinkering with heavy firearms and assault weapons... hate working on snipers.
What's that smell? Didn't think Duty allowed drinking.

Man, it's hard getting by without a drink... The work is pretty tedious, and boring. I wish I could go back to the Agroprom, but our base there is gone now. If I hadn't been relocated, I don't even know if I'd be alive - they say the base was lost during an emission in twenty-eleven... Huh, looks like we've gone way off topic. Anyway, don't be shy, now - show me your toys if you need 'em fixed.
I'll see if I have anything.
What can you tell me about Cold?
What can I say? He's earned quite a bit of respect as the current leader of our organization.
How did he earn that respect?

You see, there was some controversy regarding Lebedev, our former leader - who, by the way, I personally never met - and he didn't seem to take the opinions of the faction members into account during their crusade towards the CNPP. That mercenary certainly helped us out, but in the end, it just wasn't worth it. Those who remained at the base were unable to fight back against a resurgence made by the Renegades. The significance of our struggle in the swamps was reduced to zero... and the sacrifices on the way to the Chernobyl NPP, as well as the swamps, turned out to be in vain.
It seems like the faction's resentment towards their leader at that time was justified.

There's more to it... After our troops had returned, we had to start a long war to take everything back. We wouldn't be able to manage in day-to-day life without Cold. He received some help from unaffiliated stalkers and got in touch with people throughout the Garbage and the Cordon. Free stalkers helped us out, and having a charismatic leader certainly didn't hurt. Moreover, he's given an order to all fighters - without exceptions - not to leave here. We'll take any help, but we won't risk the lives of our guys.
Whoever Lebedev was and what he did, you aren't the same faction you used to be.
That's your opinion. Certainly has some value to it. Right now, we have no large-scale goals, nor any common ideology... Anyway, it's probably time we cut the storytelling and start the trading.
Deal.
Whose pseudodog is that?
That's Buddy, the Doctor's dog. Doctor asked Cold to keep him safe, as he's started getting a little old.
Well, by the looks of it, you wouldn't say that he needs it.
Looks can be deceiving sometimes. Pet a kind-hearted creature. Now, can I tell you about these dogs and answer your questions?
Go ahead.
Pseudodogs aren't really dogs at all. They kind of originate from wolves - Duty learned that while researching them.
That's... I need to write that down. What's the request, anyway?

By virtue of my profession, I collect all sorts of stories. To the north, there's a place similar to our swamps called Zaton. I've heard there's an old crank that lives in the old barge, and apparently, he also has a pseudodog. Perhaps you can find out if it's true, if the distance doesn't bother you.
I'll check if possible.
What's the current situation?

Well, the Syndicate only has one central base in the Zone, and it's right here. The path to Yantar is cut off because of the psy-installation, and crowds of zombies sometimes come out of there, along with mutants. Limansk has gone to shit - it's a maze full of dangers. The Red Forest is even more dangerous, since Monolith fighters have settled at the bridge to Limansk while the rest of the area is crawling with mutants. At the Army Warehouses in the east, it's all Freedom territory.
Go on.

As for any dangers, you'll see those for yourself. Keep in mind, though; when carrying out orders, you've got a job to do, and any emotions are just gonna distract you. Put those aside... There's no room for emotion, no room for morality - only intellect and calculation. And regarding other paths, the safest route is through Limansk. There's plenty of closed space where you'll be safe from sniper fire, and there is shelter where you can hide from firefights, as well as anomalies. The area's quite unpredictable, however - never gonna know what exactly's around the corner.
You say the base is central. Does that mean there are any other outposts?

There are two minor ones that I know of. The first one is in Zaton, at the edge of the northern marshes. The second one is in the southwest part of the Pripyat outskirts. We've also got a group stationed in the Wild Territory, and you can find our squads in different parts of the Zone when they carry out contracts.
So anything north of Limansk is Monolith territory.
Pretty much. There's an old hospital not far from Limansk. No point in going there - the path to the Chernobyl NPP, as well as the one leading to Yantar are both cut off by psy-emissions.
Understood, thanks for the info.
Who are you?

Congratulations - with a memory like that, you'll be the next Strelok. Listen carefully. I'm the big dog here, and you will know my name. I got here from Zaton some time ago, along with my guys. We fucked the mutants out of the base and got it back up and running. Some sod set us up, pretended to be one of us and ratted me out. Had to get the fuck out.
These rooks don't even know the rules, copping the made guys like that. Whatever that douchebag's name was, I'm going to rip him a new one.
His name was Sashenka or something - and stay out of his ass. Your prick's tiny, and his asshole is a metal maze.
Got it. Any tips on others in the Zone?

Simple. Don't trust anybody but our guys with skulls on their sleeves. Pretty much everyone else is hostile - remember that. Just try to figure things out for yourself. If you feel something's off, get your ass out of there.
Got it. Any safe places I can stay?

No such place as safe in the Zone, boy, but don't let this advice go to waste. North of us is the Truck Cemetery, and our boys there control the old checkpoint and the entrance to the Army Warehouses. Try not to hang around the cemetery at night, and stay away from all the old vehicles. Radiation levels there are high enough to make your counter ring down to your balls, and I haven't even mentioned the creatures and anomalies. There's the Garbage to the west - total chaos over there. I can't say anything else, other than there's a checkpoint to the north controlled by Duty. There's a huge forest to the south called Darkscape - really wild place, you've got soldiers patrolling there from time to time and loners pissing about. Pretty big maze. Also, there are a few stalkers at the farm on the way to the Darkscape, so don't fuck around. There's a huge advantage in that forest: the road leads to the Cordon. You'll easily find our guys at the vehicle station there.
That's kind of scary.
And what did you expect, boy? No sunshine and rainbows - this is the real life.
Alright, whatever. Thanks for the help, boss.
Why is your nickname so lousy?

Look who's talking! Goddamn greenhorns, trying to act all tough... You don't handle them, they can't even hold their own dicks straight when taking a piss. If you do, they act like lousy morons, to put it in your own words.
Hey, easy - didn't mean anything by it. Just didn't know what to say.
Alright, whatever... Apology accepted. Things ain't easy when you get old and your nerves are fucked.
Understood. How did you get your name?

I'll tell you, if only to put an end to your yapping. My story began under the Soviet Union, before the first time I ended up in prison. I wanted a good life... Did some trade hustle, and been caught for that one day. So after I did my time, I started making new connections and selling stolen stuff. Did that for three years before I, once again, ended up in jail. Got out, but the USSR was gone... You know what the most frustrating thing was?
No. Never saw the Soviet Union at a reasonable age.
First time I ended up in prison, it was "business"... or "profiteering", in old Soviet speech. Nowadays, anyone who's successful can end up behind bars. That place is where you feel your ass burning.
[continue...]

When I got out of my second stint, everything crashed down. No income at all, and there were loads of people around who were doing the same thing as I was. When the Zone came into existence, I figured I'd go see it for myself.
[continue...]
By the way, they call me Olivius because I tend to try out the cargo people take to me firsthand. I'm keen about quality and condition.
Thanks for the history lesson. Sorry once again.
Share your story, brother.
You trying to get me prosecuted or something? Whatever, get comfortable.
[continue...]

There were times when my face was constantly on a roll of honor... I worked as a mechanical engineer at a plant and got recognized in my company as the best specialist in that profession. They awarded me prizes and certificates.
I'm guessing you wanted to get some tail?
Don't interrupt me... and do pay attention to my name.
They call you Limpid because you've got something limp down under?
Real funny guy. Anyway, I enjoyed hanging out with my guys after a long shift. Had a few too many drinks... The boss caught us, and I got fired like some stupid loser.
Life's a bitch.

A bitch I doubt you've seen for real. Got a job as an ordinary locksmith and found a new friend by the name of Vitka. Barely got paid jack shit, but thankfully I earned enough to get myself a few rounds once in a while. At one time we got drunk and fucked around... Don't even remember why. Anyway, I stabbed him with a screwdriver - good thing that he didn't die right then and there. Spent a few years in maximum security, and my bitch wife sold everything and ran off. When I got released, I spent all my money on drinks and ended up in the slums... Got here when the Zone came about. Here, everyone's equal: we're all outcasts. I met up with the guys at the Garbage - they found me useful as a technician and let me stay there. Best time in my life... Tons of guns and vodka.
This isn't the Garbage.

Again with your damn interrupting. The big-ass Emission happened, and we hid like little girls. When that nightmare was over with, we had a meeting on where the fuck to go: the Garbage turned out to be a bad shelter from those kinds of emissions. We had to leave it for good and move through different roads in small groups to this place - the Dark Valley.
That's quite a story.
Who are you?
Oh, I work as the technician here at the checkpoint.
What do they call you?
No need for formality and ranks - not on the parade ground, at least. In case of any attack, my name would be too long to pronounce. Name's Sergey, though I prefer Seryoga.
Nice to meet you, Seryoga.
Likewise. If you need anything fixed up, just let me know.
What's the current situation?
Nothing interesting. There's a stalker village a bit to the north... Nothing but hostiles all the way up to Agroprom.
So... we're stuck here and in danger of being attacked at any moment?

Nah, not too long ago our commanding officers got us a BTR, reinforced our patrols, and our helicopter's always ready to go. By the way, when you leave the checkpoint northside, stay on the road. There's a minefield on both sides.
I'll keep that in mind.
Are you in charge here?
That I am. Name's Loki, right hand of Miklukha at this station.
An interesting name - like the Scandinavian deity.
It is. That's what they called me in the early days, right around when the Brain Scorcher showed up. Those were crazy times.
Could you tell me more about the events after the Scorcher?

Sure. When the Scorcher was shut down, my squad launched a campaign towards the north. We went on for some time, going through different places... As the Chernobyl power plant loomed on the horizon, we decided to look for a place to set up camp and found this station while it was empty. The Zone turned to hell, and Duty appeared. The places were strange, there weren't many people, and times were wild with emissions. After calling a truce, we agreed to keep all weapons holstered and knives sheathed in this station.
And where is Duty now?

They're not here. Anyone who we didn't manage to shoot down ran off. Not long ago, a stalker by the name of Sasha appeared and helped us out considerably - man did a lot of good things. The last piece of the puzzle he gave us was the PDA of the man who founded Duty, and according to it, he and his group were former military. Seems like he just cut off comms with the headquarters, which made local stalkers go nuts and left enemy forces confused. We kept a careful balance in this station. And thanks to the help of that stalker, we've been getting all kinds of support... from free stalkers, defectors, sympathizers, you name it. We've basically forced Duty out of here.
And where did the stalker go?
I don't know. Last time I heard, he was heading towards Jupiter with some kind of fireteam. He was a good man - hopefully he's alive and kicking.
What makes the local environment dangerous?

It's full of mutants. On top of that, you've got the Monolith... Those bastards have taken over the old depot and lined the perimeter with scouts and machine guns. Other than that, some areas are crawling with zombies, such as the old village of Kopachy west of us, as well as the ventilation complex and the Volkhov AA complex. Keep your eyes peeled, man.
Thanks. I'll keep that in mind.
Halogen flashlight
Normal halogen Chinese (although they are) flashlight low quality, not having almost any abilities to the lighting of the area and bought in near the perimeter from the supermarket.
an Ordinary flashlight
More or less acceptable option in the light of previous version. Increased lighting range, though still shitty quality flashlight.
a high Quality flashlight
Quite a good option for long forays in the Area, is quite popular among stalkers.
HSH
HSH
About work guide
What?
I saw your message. You need a guide?
I agree. Move.
OK, go!
No man, you don't have enough money to pay me the penalty.
Remind me, where are we going?
We're here.
Finally! Thanks Stalker, nice work. Here's your money.
I renounce the task.
are You sure?
Yes
Forget it.
are Looking for an experienced Stalker, who will at location [%s]. I am now [%s]. [%s]
We're too late! We agreed! Pay the penalty in [%s] rubles. [%s]
Yes, I need to go to one place. Money would not hurt.\Perez [%s] I [%s] paid [%s] rubles\pusti, if we're not, I'll take you with [%s] as the penalty
I need to be
We agreed! Pay the penalty in [%s] rubles.

Fanatic seems to be one of the more experienced stalkers in the village. He has decided to teach me a trick or two.
